references.paper_title: DiffInfinite: Large mask-image synthesis via parallel random patch diffusion in histopathology
references.reason: This paper introduces DiffInfinite, a method for generating high-resolution images using a single GPU, which directly addresses a key challenge in the field and is highly relevant to the current work.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This foundational paper introduced latent diffusion models (LDMs), a crucial technology that underpins the current work and is extensively discussed in the related work section.
This paper is a seminal work in text-to-image generation, establishing the baseline methodology that the current work builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat GANs on image synthesis
references.reason: This work demonstrated the superiority of diffusion models over GANs for image generation, providing a strong foundation for the choice of diffusion models in the current work.
This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), the theoretical underpinnings for the diffusion models used throughout this work.
